transcripts.text: I understand you're a Baby Yoda fan.

I hate that heinous little green monstrosity.  Why?  Hi, Jen.  Hello.  My name is Shogun.  I can't vote.  I can't vote.  They're not letting me vote.  Can you believe they won't let this little... But it's so cute.  But it's really sad, though, because we just took him to the vet, and the vet said that he's morbidly obese.
I think he's perfect.  Shogun wants to vote in November.  I want to vote in November.  You want to vote in November.  How are we going to get this done?
Do you know what state you're registered in?
I'm registered in Illinois.  How about you?
California.  Are you going to vote in person or by mail?
I'm going to vote by mail.  I already sent in my postcard to get my mail-in ballot.

I am going in person.  My government organizations was nice enough to send me this nice little voter registration ID card.  It's got my ID number on it.  It doesn't tell me exactly where the polling station is.  I can hunt it down.  That's on.  my to-do list is to find the nearest polling station.

polling station making a plan is like more complicated for some than others.  like some people may have to work some people may need child care or care for their aging parents or their loved one with a disability like all that stuff is.  you can handle it because I bet you there's someone in your community or in your squad who would help.  but you gotta have a plan.  so it's actually good to start now like I think Like election day is actually now.  Pretty much everything that you deal with in your day-to-day life is at stake here.  Everything that pisses you off, like you need to go see the doctor and you can't afford it.  Is the post office able to function properly?  Is the minimum wage an actual wage that you can survive off of working at your job?

And a lot of times I hear from young people or I'll read young people online.  They'll be like, oh, they're all corrupt.  I'm not going to vote for anybody.  Yes, we have a lot of imperfect representatives or people running for office.  You know, however, vote the issues.  Just pick two or three issues that are important to you.  Just vote those issues because that does make a big difference.

My good friend Alicia Garza, her mom used to tell her that if you leave something on the table, someone else is going to eat it.  If you don't get in there and try to shape how it goes, someone else is going to take it.  So don't you want to get in there?

In the last election, hundreds of thousands of mail-in ballots were not counted because they were sent in late or the signature was on the wrong place.  You've got to make sure to sign at the right place.  and then you seal it, and then you put it in the other envelope, you know, follow the directions.

And send it in early.  Don't wait.  Like, I have a pack of, like, literally a whole stack of envelopes, and I don't open them, and I just kind of, like, shuffle them around here and there when I'm cleaning.  Don't do that to your ballot.  Go to participantsvote.com.  If you can vote, because I can't, they won't let me vote.
I don't think you should call him morbidly obese anymore.  It might not be good for his self-esteem.
It's what the doctor said right in front of him, but you may be right about that.
